title: A Cry for Redemption
shortSummary: Psalm 130 is a heartfelt plea from the depths of despair, expressing deep repentance and hopeful trust in God's mercy and forgiveness. It emphasizes waiting patiently on the Lord and the assurance of redemption for Israel. This psalm highlights the transformative power of God's grace and the believer's confident hope in His Word.
timeline: c. 1000 BC - United Monarchy period, traditionally attributed to David

keyCharacters.name: The Psalmist
keyCharacters.description: The author who cries out from the depths of despair, expressing penitence and hope in God's mercy.

keyCharacters.name: Israel
keyCharacters.description: The collective people of God, called to place their hope and trust in the Lord's redeeming power.

definitions.definition: A category of Psalms (Psalms 120-134) possibly sung by pilgrims ascending to Jerusalem for worship.
Sins or moral wrongdoings; offenses against God's law.
Earnest and humble prayers or requests made to God.
The act of being saved or delivered from sin and its consequences through God's mercy.

outline.heading: A Cry from the Depths
outline.description: The psalmist calls out to the Lord from a place of deep distress, pleading for God to hear his voice and be attentive to his prayers.

outline.heading: Recognition of Sin and Need for Forgiveness
outline.description: Acknowledging that if God were to judge strictly by sin, no one could stand; yet there is forgiveness with God, inspiring reverence and hope.

outline.heading: Patient Waiting and Hope in God's Word
outline.description: The psalmist expresses a deep, eager waiting for the Lord, comparing it to those who watch expectantly for the morning light.

outline.heading: Call for Israel to Hope in the Lord
outline.description: An exhortation to the people of Israel to place their hope in God's mercy and abundant redemption, with the assurance that He will redeem them from all their sins.

application: Approach God honestly and humbly in prayer, especially in times of deep distress or guilt.
Recognize the seriousness of sin but also embrace the hope found in God's forgiveness and mercy.
Practice patient waiting on the Lord, trusting in His timing and promises.
Encourage others to place their hope in God's redeeming power and faithfulness.

keyVerses.text: If thou, LORD, shouldest mark iniquities, O Lord, who shall stand?
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights the universal human need for God's mercy, acknowledging that no one can stand justified by their own righteousness.

keyVerses.text: I wait for the LORD, my soul doth wait, and in his word do I hope.
keyVerses.significance: It expresses the believer's confident and patient hope grounded in God's promises revealed in His Word.

keyVerses.text: Let Israel hope in the LORD: for with the LORD there is mercy, and with him is plenteous redemption.
keyVerses.significance: This verse assures God's people of His abundant mercy and the fullness of redemption available through Him.
